alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 3:46PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lafayette, west central Union and southeastern Marshall Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 346 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bethlehem, or near Wall Doxey State Park, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wall Doxey State Park, Bethlehem, Cambridge, Etta, Malone, Keel, Waterford, Spraggins, Cornersville, Burt and Gilton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern and northwestern Mississippi.
